website_summaries.verdict: Extremely affordable back machine that may require a few tweaks for comfort.
pros: Very simple to set up, light, and easy to use
Several adjustable settings allow it to work well for different shapes and sizes
cons: Somewhat flimsy, as some users complain of stability issues

website_summaries.verdict: A high-end steel roman chair to expand the capabilities of a home gym.
pros: Facilitates a variety of bodyweight exercises as well as kettlebell and dumbbell work
Steel construction is strong and provides a max capacity of 300 pounds
Main pad has a cut out down middle of the pad for improved hip ergonomics
Stellar for improving the strength of your back and core
cons: The footplate is not adjustable, which may present difficulties for people over 6 feet

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for home gym!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing buy for any garage or home gym If you’re expecting $800 commercial GHD machine for $120, then reset your expectations. However this will perfectly serve as a mini GHD machine for a home gym. I’m 6’1, 195 lbs, and this thing is perfectly capable of handling sit-ups, Hip & back extensions, and more! Fantastic addition for my home gym!
customer_reviews.author: Tim Haddix

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Adjustable... buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'2" and 220 this unit is adjustable to fit me and my wife. It's solid, strong and great for men because of the 'cut out' area in the support pads. Excellent for all core work. Highly recommend it over the other units.
customer_reviews.author: Maverick

customer_reviews.title: It’s not secure, but it won’t fail
customer_reviews.text: I’m exactly six feet tall 180lbs. When I use this equipment it wiggles, it wobbles, it’ll even lift off the ground about an inch if you’re going hard, but it has not failed me (ie. tipped over, broken, bent). If you accept these conditions and are able to focus on your workout, than it’ll work for you. But if all of extra motion will be too much of a distraction and cause you to worry, than I’d say skip this one unless you’ll be securing it to another surface.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon L.

customer_reviews.title: Fairly priced, but some improvements can be made.
customer_reviews.text: The product seems sturdy and was simple to put together. I used pliers (not included) to hold the nut as I used the Allen wrench (included) to tighten the bolts. This made the bench much sturdier. The only suggestion I do have, however, is the cradle that the handle and pad assembly slides into does not fit snuggly enough. Even with the bolts tightened fully, the whole assembly can tilt enough than it may be difficult to maintain your balance if the majority of your body weight is on the handles. While I’m confident that the handles won’t detach completely, that small ‘wiggle’ from that loose fit makes me a little less than comfortable when I lean forward.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Not well suited for anyone over six feet.
customer_reviews.text: This works pretty well for a home set up for when I don't feel like or don't have the time to make it into the gym. If you are over six foot however you might have some difficulty with it. I am 5 - 10 and have the middle extension out as far as it will go and the foot rests still feel too close to get a good stretch in the starting position. The middle bar really needs to be able to extend another six or eight inches at least.
customer_reviews.author: M. Noland

customer_reviews.title: This is a solid Chair
customer_reviews.text: For reference, I'm about 5'8", 170lb, male. The split pads were important to me because I've used a "nutcracker" before and it's a bad experience. This one is comfortable and very stable. I do a lot of back extensions with extra weight, and I've never worried about this flipping or falling. I also have not added any weight or extensions to the base. It's high quality, but kind of a pain to assemble. Be VERY CAREFUL to match the parts to the pictures, or you'll be disassembling and doing it over as I did.
customer_reviews.author: ODH3

customer_reviews.title: Good for sit ups and hyperextensions
customer_reviews.text: Good for sit ups and hyperextensions. Plenty solid for safety at 250lbs. slight movement at bolted areas, not perceivable while using, but there. Not as solid as a machine that's welded or less pieces, but no issues in months of heavy use, even weighted. Easily adjustable to fit anyone. My daughter at 4ft to myself at well over 6ft can use it. Actually has plenty of length left when I'm using
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big & Happy
customer_reviews.text: I just put it together and seems solid enough on it's initial try. I am 6'1" and 250# (for now Ha!) and not even more than halfway out on the adjustment for length. Directions were simple enough and really only need to look at the picture to put it together. It would have been a 5 star if the lower foot/ankle cushion bar was adjustable. To me they seem a tad far apart but for the price I paid I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: No issues like I have read in other reviews. Easy to assemble. I weight 230 and there is a little movement when I use it, as expected. I hung 30lbs off the end where my feet go in there is no movement now. I have a buddy weighing 185 and has no movement when he uses it.
customer_reviews.author: Chad A. Margo

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, Easy Setup, Good piece of equipment!
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup, simple instructions, super quick delivery. One thing you have to know before buying is.... this is not the Rouge Fitness GHD. It’s a simple Roman Chair(hence the price). I use it every day(6’3” 275lbs male). It’s a little wobbly at the seat side, change the bolts out(simple and easy improvement). Also if you want or need extra stability just get 2”x4”x3’-4’ and bolt it to the already predrilled holes on the feet. Other than that... it’s a great workout tool and you’ll get a nice core workout(with proper technique). If you don’t want to spend $1000 on the more expensive equipment, this is the perfect fit. I recommend this piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Drea cote

customer_reviews.title: Amazon doesn't have NEGATIVE STARS--but they SHOULD
customer_reviews.text: The concept was good, but the flexing of the entire bench at the foot pads and the cross bar make this unsafe and not worth a dime. Pieces came rusted or poorly painted and some of the bolts were so poorly fabricated that the hex wrench couldn't fit in the hole. DO NOT BUY THIS! Now I have to take it apart, wedge it back in the box and drag it to UPS. Oh, great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It gets the job done, but it could be better.
customer_reviews.text: This gets the job done, but could be better. Feels a little cheap as you use it. It also sits pretty low to the ground compared to other roman chairs so when you use the dip handle bar feature your knees almost hit the ground. I'm 5'11 so if you are shorter than that it wont be a problem, but 6' or taller may want to look at another roman chair.
customer_reviews.author: Matt M

customer_reviews.title: Another "Do NOT buy" review!
customer_reviews.text: One part was completely missing, another was bent so much it couldn't be assembled properly. Customer service goes to a full mailbox and they don't respond at all even after I filled out all of the proper forms. What's worse, is that you will likely NOT BE ABLE TO RETURN this because it would be such a pain to pack up. You'd need to get your own huge box, etc, etc... just be smart and get a different roman chair. If you buy this one after reading this then you're twice the fool I was.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff Rowe

customer_reviews.title: ASSEMBLE IT PROPERLY / USE THE RIGHT TOOLS!!
customer_reviews.text: After putting the roman chair together and testing it, I'm 100% satisfied with the overall quality. This is a very sturdy and reliable piece of equipment, provided YOU USE THE RIGHT TOOLS and ASSEMBLE IT PROPERLY. I'm 47 y/o and have been working out since I was 16. I know what I'm talking about. Please disregard the bad reviews. By reading them, I can tell the equipment wasn't assembled correctly. If you fail to tighten up the screws / nutters, yes, it'll feel wobbly and rickety. DISCLAIMER: If you are training to become the next Mr. Olympia, then you probably need to look for alternative options.
customer_reviews.author: Common Sense

customer_reviews.title: Not for the heavy user
customer_reviews.text: This is not stable like the commercial quality devices. Expect movement between the two main pieces (where the horizontal adjuster knob is) during use. It is not the most stable joint and the heavier users will notice a noise within the horizontal joint, especially if you’re making quick movements. I’m on the smaller side & am making slow-controlled motions so it doesn’t bother me as much.
customer_reviews.author: S. H.

customer_reviews.title: Back sculpting please
customer_reviews.text: I’m working on building a bigger gym at home. Being a personal trainer I love the use of different equipment, Amazon has made this possible by offering products that I can afford and don’t have to wait for. This machine is very versatile, I do get a little scared when I’m first getting on but that’s because I’m super clumsy lol but it works, and I’m happy I added it to my gym.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Brodecky

customer_reviews.title: 6 pac in 2 weeks!!!
customer_reviews.text: What if I told you the only reason anyone ever left a bad review was so you wouldnt get a 6 pac like them? Seriously 2 weeks going hard and your abs will be fire. Unless you have a problem with digestion then do a nice meal hydrochloric acid cardio and fasting and a little tumeric pills when you eat you will drop 10 pounds in a week without really trying that hard. Water sometimes makes you fat if your kidneys is messin up but the doctors cant really confirm that all the time so... Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Saied Alvarian

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'9" and 270 lbs. Back hyperextension = solid Abs or obliques = not confident The base can use a little extra stability IMO. Overall a good product for the price
customer_reviews.author: Cruiser

customer_reviews.title: Like most people on here are saying
customer_reviews.text: Like most people on here are saying, it’s ok for the price. You get what you pay for but it is kinda flimsy. Really the only think i don’t like is the way your feet position on the backplate. It constantly shifts and that piece is’t very sturdy. Everything else is good.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Reese

customer_reviews.title: Not all German chairs are created equal. Thumbs down for this piece !
customer_reviews.text: I’m a 5’3” very active woman. I’ve started creating a somewhat successful home gym and thought this piece would be a great asset. Well was I wrong bc it’s basically useless to me, it’s just not adjustable enough for my height, the padding lands on my stomach at the shortest setting, causing me pain. Plus the pads are too straight and not at an angle how they should be. Would not recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: madelyn mendez

customer_reviews.title: Backsaver!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very solid piece of equipment. It was easy to put together. Way more adjustable than the ones at the gym. I'm 6'2" and about 250, it has no trouble handling my size and weight. A couple of quick clicks and it fits my girlfriend perfectly too. At this price, if you're even considering buying one, just do it, you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: JPrimeTop Contributor: Metal Detecting

customer_reviews.title: Works strengthening my lower back
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for 2 months now and it holds me up with no issues, I'm 6 feet tall and weight 220 pounds, plus I'm using a 45 pound plate to exercise lying facing the floor and facing the ceiling doing 3 sets each direction. I started with just body weight and work my way up with no stability issues and it was easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Reginald Jefferson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design, but a little awkward to put together
customer_reviews.text: If you take the time to build this correctly, it not only will be perfectly level, but it it doesn’t even creak under my 200lb 6’1” frame. Final bolt tightening needs to be done while it’s sitting on an even surface though, and the bolts(All of them) need to be really cranked to make it totally solid. For $150? I’m pretty amazed
customer_reviews.author: Seth Balmer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together, works fine.
customer_reviews.text: Put it together in about 15 minutes and I use it 4-5x per week; it's perfect for various sit ups and reverse hyper extensions. A niche piece of equipment, but I am happy with it. It is sturdy enough, a little wobble, but I have never felt like it was going to fall or break; the adjustable length is a nice feature to get it set right for the best comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Gauge

customer_reviews.title: excellent roman chair
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why some reviewer stating this is not sturdy. I sometimes wonder what are you doing on this chair.. for it's purpose, both my son and I are 6ft and 180LB and 230LB respectively, we have used it daily without an issue. Absolutely no sense of rocking or falling.
customer_reviews.author: DrDJin

customer_reviews.title: Question about pads
customer_reviews.text: Received this today; it's pretty beefy. Good for back extensions. It wobbles a bit but still sturdy. The question we have is the cylinder pads are two different sizes and one set doesn't reach to the end of bars *see pic??? Please advise how we get this resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Customer Support.... Period
customer_reviews.text: Works like it should. It arrived with one of the four round foam rubber pieces missing. YOU WILL NOT GET SOMEONE ON THE PHONE, they will not call you back after leaving many VM’s. In summary, if all comes complete then all is well... Good luck!!!
customer_reviews.author: STEPHEN

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: As shipped this is IMPOSSIBLE to put together. Not difficult, impossible. Brackets are welded in the wrong place, making assembly impossible. Really, really disappointing. Customer service gets an F-. Keep looking. This is not the one you want.
customer_reviews.author: teal blue eyes

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use!
customer_reviews.text: One sad little tack weld is intended to provide support on the foot end. Mine sheared off on the first use, and cannot be easily repaired. The top cross bar looks to be assembled in the same way. Please be VERY aware, as this could present a dangerous condition when used. Sorry to have committed the time to assembling this piece of equipment. This is my first negative product review. At the modest price point, I did not anticipate much, but this is inexcusable and potentially dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: J. Paul

customer_reviews.title: Very unsturdy and then terrible customer service from CAP
customer_reviews.text: Very unsturdy and then terrible customer service from CAP. None of the metal pieces made contact and the whole thing was wobbly. It would've needed to be welded together to be safe. Piece of junk. Don't waste your money or your time.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Saylor

customer_reviews.title: Cap Strength Roman Chair
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about ordering this after reading some ofther reviews but I couldn't be any happier with my purchase. Exactly what I wanted. I purchased a mat to put it on. No issues with slipping and sliding or damaging the floor very stable. Not sure what the other reviews issues were with the wobbling and unsteardiness but mine is very sturdy and doesn't wobble at all. Highly recommend~
customer_reviews.author: Karen McKee

customer_reviews.title: Rip those abs
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always worked out and remember using this product as a young man. Recently my gym purchased two. I used one and immediately wanted one for my home. My abs have tightened up more in the last two weeks and I’m glad I bought it. It will get good use.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K. Barfield

customer_reviews.title: It is ok
customer_reviews.text: I have it in my house so I did not want to bolt to my floor and it was very sturdy and I did not feel safe on it. I took cement blocks and put them on the floor bars and now I feel safe but it is not very attractive looking.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Low Quality padding makes it uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: There are 2 pads which were different heights and had "sharp" edges because the foam is thin and hard. The real problem is that they are different heights and that throws off your balance. My old roman chair had a single thick pad and it was far more comfortable to use. The foot restraints should be adjustable for distance between the pads so your feet don't flop around.
customer_reviews.author: homer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the home
customer_reviews.text: Before I begin, I am comparing this with ones that you would find in a CrossFit box. That being said, I love this and use it all the time as a GHD. This is perfect for the home or garage gym. I added weight to the foot posts as a counter balance. Other than that, this product is amazing and I totally recommend it for the intermediate functional fitness athlete.
customer_reviews.author: OHthatWESTON

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not stable for tall peeps. Engineered a fix
customer_reviews.text: Cost was great, easy to assemble but not meant for tall peeps. I’m 6’2” 205 lb. I find that I need to put my 50lb dumbbells over the rear floor base to keep it from rising off the floor as I use this. Reminds me of a swing set that comes out of the ground while swinging
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Bad item
customer_reviews.text: This item is juke don't buy it if I hadn't put it together, I would have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael  Fox

customer_reviews.title: its worth the money
customer_reviews.text: i have used this now for several weeks, its steady, the only concern i have is that the handles and pads seem to move when applying pressure. its a mild thing, and so far it's holding up. the adjustments work fine, I am 5'6" , and have no problem with that.
customer_reviews.author: t

customer_reviews.title: It is a miracle that it doesn't just fall apart when being used.
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'10" and weigh around 145 pounds. This chair bend and twists like I weigh double or triple that amount though. The problem is that it is poorly designed with too many parts bolted together instead of being wielded.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have scoliosis, and I am also an amateur bodybuilder. Bought this first thing when my gym closed (due to COVID), gotta keep up my booty. I use this in place of the Rogue brand GHD I use almost daily at my gym. This Roman chair allows me to do all of my favorite exercises. It’s not as comfortable as the GHD while doing “hamstring sit-ups” but it gets the job DONE. Assembly was fairly easy, but I’m an engineer- so take that with a grain of salt 🤣
customer_reviews.author: Kyla Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Buyyyyyy
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing bad about this product quality is amazing does what it's supposed to do and for the money you cannot beat it the only brand I would buy over this would be Rogue Elite FTS
customer_reviews.author: tyler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, easy to follow directions to assemble
customer_reviews.text: excellent product, about 35 - 45 minutes to assemble with one person, only reason for not 5 stars is it should be 1 half tube cushion instead of 2 separate flat cushions
customer_reviews.author: Lopidious1

customer_reviews.title: I like it but will be adding my own diamond plate ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it gets 5 stars. Otherwise only 4. I like it but will be adding my own diamond plate Footrest to the exising one.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: The assembly instructions were easy to follow and didn't take long to put together
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised. I use it for sit-ups, lower back, and side crunches. The assembly instructions were easy to follow and didn't take long to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Shere

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: For the price you can't beat it. Better ones are out there for many times the price. I read reviews complaining about it tipping but I haven't had an issue and it's just sitting on a rubber mat.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S.

customer_reviews.title: Simple yet invaluable
customer_reviews.text: It is the single most important exercise machine for lower back alignment and muscle strengthening. There are no moving parts and almost nothing that can fail. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ray J

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly but can be fixed
customer_reviews.text: For the money it's a good deal. It does what it is supposed to do. The assembly was rather painless. It's rated at 300lbs. I'm 230 and this thing was extremely wobbly. Prolly due to the one support running throught the center with nothing more than a pin and plastic sleeve holding it together. I'm taking a 1x4 and bolting my own brace under the backbone of it in hopes to sturdy it up a little. If I do that, I won't be able to adjust the length in the middle anymore but I don't care.
customer_reviews.author: Ezra Conner

customer_reviews.title: Not GHD - back extensions and situps
customer_reviews.text: Does feel a bit flimsy, which I was expected - 6-1 225, but I’m not terribly worried about it breaking. Plus it’s got leg anchor holes if you really to go wild on it. The reason I am so unimpressed is that it’s not a true Roman chair/GHD. It’s a back extension and sit-up device. It’s also a huge pain for me to return so now I have a machine with 40% of the capacity I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's great if you want to do sit-ups in it or ...
customer_reviews.text: It's great if you want to do sit-ups in it or maybe if you're a small frame person. I tried to do leg curls and that didn't go well. I had to weigh one end down or else it tipped over. I will say it's pretty low cost for what you're getting, so points on value.
customer_reviews.author: A B

customer_reviews.title: Not very adjustable or stable
customer_reviews.text: Works fine for my giant husband, but it's not made for smaller people. The ankle stability bars aren't adjustable so my feet slip right out with ease (they're wobbly, too). I wish it were a better buy.
customer_reviews.author: My two cents

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: Was excited for this bench but when finally assembled, it was not sturdy at all. Cheaply made, was bent in a few places and had to straighten it out. I am only 112 pounds and fit but the climbing position on this bench is very awkward and it did not hook my feet securely. I wanted something easy to hop on/off to do my workout but this takes some adjusting. Not worth the price, so returning!
customer_reviews.author: ddh

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and great quality
customer_reviews.text: This Roman chair is like the sturdy good ones at the gym and well priced! I would recommend this absolutely for your abs and lower back. Super sturdy and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Elina Allen

customer_reviews.title: more versatile than it looks
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase. I use it for hip extensions, reverse hip extensions, hamstring curls (with added resistance) and preacher curls.
customer_reviews.author: Skatie

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Best option for the price for sure. I'm pretty big and have no issue with tipping or stability. I assume most negative reviews are from people misusing the equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Roth

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy with no issues.
customer_reviews.text: Easy enough to assemble. No issues. I’ve had it for a few years with no issues. I’m 5’3 my husband is 6’2 and we can both use it.
customer_reviews.author: r davis

customer_reviews.title: Helps with lower back pain
customer_reviews.text: It is an awesome deal for the price. If it isn't bolted down it will wobble slightly. Not enough to fall over or anything in my experience. It helps with lower back pain.
customer_reviews.author: Lea

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good
customer_reviews.text: Instructions are a nightmare but this is very heavy duty, well packaged and sturdy. Fits for a range of heights and weights.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Rear support post was not drilled correctly, but company replaced it quickly. Using this regularly helps to strengthen lumbar and hamstrings.
customer_reviews.author: Dia

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied Customer
customer_reviews.text: I received my chair yesterday and I am very pleased. All the parts fix perfectly and it was easy to put together. My husband, who is over 230 pounds tested it out and it was very sturdy and stable. I also invited a female friend, who is more than 200 pounds, over this morning to test it out and again it was sturdy and stable. I will report back in 30 days to let you know how my new equipment is holding up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seat isn’t comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Helps with alleviating back pain and working out abs. Seat is hard. Had to add a cushion for comfort!!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Barlow

customer_reviews.title: Loose parts in box, missing pieces.
customer_reviews.text: The most ridiculous shipping ever. All parts were loose and scratched to hell. Missing pads and parts. Sending this crap back.
customer_reviews.author: pinky

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: On a budget. This is for u. Im 240 and it holds me well.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Just as shown.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly as shown in the picture. A 2nd set of hands for assembly is helpful, but not required.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality But Lack Padding Support
customer_reviews.text: Instruction for the chair was easy to follow and assemble. The padding is thin and not very soft. It hurts my stomach & leg when I work out.
customer_reviews.author: Bao Long

customer_reviews.title: Best on the planet
customer_reviews.text: All of the above!!!!!! amazing stuff,best on the planet no question about that. Thank you so much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap material all around!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not even 35 days into this product the seat portion broke. Made of cheap particle board under the material. If I could leave a negative start review I would.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The chair itself is sturdy, yet the metal pieces arrived without predrilled holes ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this a few months back as a gift. Only got around to opening the box this month with the person for the gift was intended. The chair itself is sturdy, yet the metal pieces arrived without predrilled holes for the hardware. So now, we're forced to drill all of the holes ourselves to make the equipment functional.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly Equipment
customer_reviews.text: I should have checked the reviews before making my purchase and that would have helped me have a realistic expectation for the equipment I purchased. The foot plate is very wobbly and the bars are not adjustable, where your legs are. I’m about 5’1” so it’s hard to get comfortable with the space being so large. I haven’t been able to yet find the ability to focus on the workout and not worry about my feet moving the whole time.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Berry

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, but decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality, but decent for the price. It doesn't seem very stable with noticeable wobbling when in use, especaially at the foot/ankle rest and the horizontal bar.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick but damaged in shipping, seats will need repair.
customer_reviews.text: Does the trick but damaged in shipping, seats will need repair.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Davis

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly yet functional.
customer_reviews.text: It is wobbly. However, I am comfortable using this for bodyweight exercises. I'm 200 pounds, 6'2". It fits me well and is comfortable, it just doesn't feel that study. Definitely not gym quality; but OK for home.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: ...if you use it, you will be happy you bought it...
customer_reviews.text: ...only one caveat to mention, wish I had bought this years ago
customer_reviews.author: Dean J. Scofield

customer_reviews.title: Works Great !
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would wobble excessively like some prior comments, but I don't see it wobble as much. I like it very much. Thank you. :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Will work for my home use. Not bad price for quality. Solid for bodyweight movements. I wouldn't add weight unless it was anchored to the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Drew J.

customer_reviews.title: Easy too assemble, cheap, Very flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of parts are loose, the screws are too long and do not look secure however it did it break or fall apart on me. The whole chair is rather flimsy and you do not feel confident with it at all. If the screws were tight and the resting piece of the chair adjustable this product would be 4 stars for sure. Assembly is very quick and easy. Same pieces to secure a bunch of different parts.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Tan

customer_reviews.title: A Must for Every Home Gym
customer_reviews.text: Its a must have, for a complete home gym workout, especially if you don't have access to hamstring curls. You might need some glue to keep pieces in and need to tighten screws that have come loose, but overall, I'm very pleased with this piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.author: malayla

customer_reviews.title: I wish it would work yet it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: pads are way too hard and the fit is weird
customer_reviews.author: Tia Browder

customer_reviews.title: 5'11" ,. 220. Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Was alittle scared reading reviews so I used mine next to bed till I knew it wouldn't fall over.but I like it.
customer_reviews.author: kurt

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I deal with lower back pain daily this has helped me take my physical therapy to a whole new level
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: works well.
customer_reviews.text: fair quality in construction. not the model that I was initially looking for but for the price worth it.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Works for me 6'3 280lbs
customer_reviews.text: I am 6'3 280 lbs and this machine fits me. You have to tighten all the bolts and the adjustment knobs. If the adjustment knobs are not tight the unit will feel wobbly. Works great so far
customer_reviews.author: Superman

customer_reviews.title: P.O.S.
customer_reviews.text: Total P.O.S.!! Dont waist your money. I wouldn't take it if they gave it to me for free. It is so flimsy I'm scared to get on it even after going over every nut and bolt and tighting.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley McInturff

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: Works well, don't rest weght on pads when getting on, there weak use the metal handles to support your weght when getting on. Other than that it's been great to help me strengthen my injured back.
customer_reviews.author: Blitz-Dobe

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I've been enjoying this for a few weeks now. Seems pretty sturdy and I don't have any issues. Pretty easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: azwinediva

customer_reviews.title: Great machine
customer_reviews.text: I’m 6 ft tall and this machine is great especially since adjustments can be made for height and length. I’m very satisfied with this machine.
customer_reviews.author: G. fulsom

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I ordered.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this to strengthen my lower back and in general my core. It is exactly what I thought it would be. Strong, sturdy, and comfortable enough. I am only 5'7 so I have it set to the shortest distance. I'm sure it would be fine for the vertically gifted.
customer_reviews.author: mark l daly

customer_reviews.title: Abmazing
customer_reviews.text: I us it for my ab workouts amazing and it's out of the way
customer_reviews.author: heatherlee perdue

customer_reviews.title: Ahhhh
customer_reviews.text: Mediocre. Moves while you use. In 2 pieces that constantly shift no matter how tight the screws are.
customer_reviews.author: Scooch

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for price easy to use. Like that its adjustable for height being 6'4"
customer_reviews.author: Germel Harkless

customer_reviews.title: Decent Roman Chair
customer_reviews.text: No assembly issues - just bolt it together, took about 1/2 hour. Solid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's worth it
customer_reviews.text: Works great it's a big help in my workout routine
customer_reviews.author: Barney

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Perfect item. Great core stretch and strengthen. Exactly what I needed at a very fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Kalthoff

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - Parts dont fit together
customer_reviews.text: The parts do not fit together. One of the cross bars had holes drilled incorrectly. because of this it cannot be used. The phone number provided by he manufacturer goes to a full voicemail and there was no response from the email address they provided.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Lane

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Sturdy, stable and well made
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Sturdy, strong, stable and well-made. Easily adjustable so you can get just the right fit. The dual anchor pads work well for back extensions or stomach crunches. It was easy to put together in about 30 minutes with the included Allen wrench and another wrench for tightening.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Malloy

customer_reviews.title: little wably
customer_reviews.text: IT works great but it wiggles a little no matter how hard you try to tighten it.
customer_reviews.author: GAC

customer_reviews.title: No tools
customer_reviews.text: Good machine with it. I have it in my bedroom very sturdy I weight 130. Got to tight the screws for it to be sturdy. It doesn't come with no tool so that was a struggle.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Not the best place Roman chair
customer_reviews.text: Very overbuilt. Uncomfortable to use. Heavy and feet of chair can easily mark up the floor.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea but needs more attention to detail
customer_reviews.text: Good for a home gym but the pads fit uneven and after a workout it killed my lower back and hip
customer_reviews.author: AARON P.

customer_reviews.title: Really sturdy and nice chair for the money
customer_reviews.text: Really sturdy and nice chair for the money. The pad is a little harder than I'd like, but it isn't horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: I'm 5'-10" and I have it on the 4th hole out of 8.
customer_reviews.text: It's sturdy, and I just have it on the 4th hole out of 8, which is another like 6" of stretch. I'm 5'-10". Makes me wonder if the people complaining built it wrong?
customer_reviews.author: Do it

product_meta.title: CAP Barbell Strength Roman Chair
product_meta.description: The CAP Strength Roman Chair is made of sturdy steel and can support users up to 300-pounds. Ideal for home use.
feature_bullets: Great for GHD, Sit Up, Hip Back Extension
